intro: Oxychloris scariosa, commonly known as the scarious oxychloris, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia. Its leaves are narrow and often have a rough texture, while the fruits are small, dry, and three-angled. Oxychloris scariosa is often found in disturbed habitats and can thrive in full sun conditions.
